content.raw:
Ah cool so I'm totally wrong, MAC doesn't use ELF. I wonder if they used to or if I was just wrong about this - howcome it's the same download of mathematica for 'unix' regardless of whether you're on linux or macos then? Whatever.

Let's keep all the extensions then as compiled for the separate platforms, and use `sys.platform` (which is not a function it turns out). If you're writing the if statements, on linux sys.platform is 'linux2' or 'linux', and on Windows it's 'win32' (even if it's a 64 bit OS)
content.html:
Ah cool so I'm totally wrong, MAC doesn't use ELF. I wonder if they used to or if I was just wrong about this - howcome it's the same download of mathematica for 'unix' regardless of whether you're on linux or macos then? Whatever.

Let's keep all the extensions then as compiled for the separate platforms, and use sys.platform (which is not a function it turns out). If you're writing the if statements, on linux sys.platform is 'linux2' or 'linux', and on Windows it's 'win32' (even if it's a 64 bit OS)
